That's not going to work.

You need a change in your state of consciousness. You can contemplate from your current state of consciousness for 100 years and get no closer.

Do a practice that changes your state. Everything else is a waste of time.

The compassion is that I'm trying to save you 40 years.

item.title: Shocking part of Leo's new video
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

All this mental masturbation has to stop. You cannot reach God-consciousness this way.

Do the practices and search for TRUTH! Not some ideas you heard from me.

You are NOT going to be able to get a preview of God-consciousness by thinking about it. Not even close. Not even 0.001%. So cut that shit before you waste 5 years of your life.

item.title: Shocking part of Leo's new video
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
5 minutes ago, Waken said:

@Leo GuraI don't think you're clear on this point, so can you just tell me what your position is on this one:
Do you think that only your mind, "Leo"-mind exists, and that I'm not experiencing? You think this message you are reading has not been written by anyone?
Because that's what you're saying right, when you say only your mind exists

Reality is perspectival.

From my perspective I am all alone.

Your experience is my imagination. But then again, the house I'm sitting in is also my imagination. So it makes little difference. Imagination IS reality.

And all of this, is your imagination!

It's a twisted, twisted mindfuck.

You have to really stop drawing a difference between you and me.

@Leo Gura this is still confusing to me. Am I imagining you or are you imagining me? Iâm clearly having an inner experience but if youâre imagining me that wouldnât be the case. And of course I canât prove to you Iâm having an experienceÂ 

You can't use the logical mind to understand ONENESS.

You will keep being confused until you realize you are God.

item.title: Shocking part of Leo's new video
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
5 minutes ago, Waken said:

Could it be that you lost the distinction between your finite mind and the infinite mind? You had an insight in being the infinite mind, but perhaps made a mistake in now thinking your finite mind is the infinite mind andÂ hence think that when your finite mind stops imagine other or multiple minds, it's the infinite mind that will stop imagining that?
I'm very cautious about taking your word there. That in my mind I have imaged other minds, I don't see how that means that there are no 'other' minds

Find out for yourself.

I'll give you a clue: ONENESS

5 minutes ago, captainamerica said:

@Leo Gura Love and surrender isÂ  commonly considered to be the end of all as well as thrown out a lot in spiritual circles. Somehow you are a sinner if you don't let go of practicality. Love alone won't feed someone who is hungry , you need some form of power and thinking on your own to do this.Â 

I think power must also be one of the fundamental building blocks of reality and not just love/surrender. And there must be implications to that understanding in the daily lives as well. If properly understood. What do you say?Â 

You're taking about survival. Your desire for survival forces you to stop loving unconditionally.

It is literally impossible for a finite being such as yourself to have unconditional infinite love. Only the Godhead can have that because for that you must be totally selfless, formless, and you must completely give up your life.

Love doesn't care about survival. It is completely impractical, yet it's what creates the entire Universe.

item.title: Shocking part of Leo's new video
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
24 minutes ago, captainamerica said:

@Leo Gura sincerely, how do I reconcile that with the fact that love without power is anemic?

What??

item.title: Shocking part of Leo's new video
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
50 minutes ago, Waken said:

@electroBeamÂ yes I read that, but that sounds like it could be a misunderstanding to me, or just misinterpretation on our part. Even Rupert Spira said that the absolute mind can dream/think/live many lives at once, he's not saying there the absolute is only dreaming up one dream. There only being one dream is solipsism.Â Maybe the distinction between I the absolute and I as the individual expression got mixed up there? idk.
I interpreted it like that in my trip too, that all dreams would collapse. But perhaps that's only because from my own POV, I created everything, the notions of other, etc. and it is that notion that goes, which might have created the feeling that all dreams would collapse. If Leo mahasamadi's, I won't stop experiencing right.

Â 

This is what I mean.

Rupert Spira is lost in his own mind here. He's still not understanding how radical nonduality truly is. Other minds are being imagined by him. He still doesn't understand that not only are other minds his own imagination, even his own past states and memories are all imagined in the present. Rupert Spira is imagining that he's ever had a past mind.

This is why you should do 5-MeO-DMT. Self-inquiry is not going to be enough to bust through that illusion. He's been at this for 40 years and yet he's still subtly trapped in duality and imagination.

Like I warned you guys, be very careful who you consider to be truly awake.

There is no Leo's mahasamadhi. You have imagined Leo! There is only YOUR mahasamadhi. When you awaken, you will realize that Leo is some bullshit idea you invented to deepen your dream. You are imagining my mahasamadhi so that you can avoid your own. You clever devil.

If another living being appears to you, it's because you imagine it. Your mother and father are imaginary. Try swallowing that one.

Since you are God, you are ABSOLUTE. That means you have total access to everything that exists. The trick is, the only thing that exits, is whatever appears right now. Period. That's Absolute Consciousness.

There is nothing behind the curtain. But is sure fucking seems like there is. Because your imagine it. Most people are so terrified of this possibility that they just insist on imagining others. And so they stay lost in the dream.

Acceptance is part of it. But that is far too neutral and cold of a term. Love captures it perfectly. God doesn't merely accept itself. God is IN FUCKING LOVE with itself.

Imagine giving yourself an orgasm that never ends because you recognize how beautiful you are.

item.title: How to cope with afternoon slump/fatigue
item.description:
in Health, Fitness, Nutrition

Get your blood work for your hormones. Especially TSH, Free T3, Free T4, cortisol, and Vit D. Thyroid and adrenals are the biggest concern to test.

In most states you can buy bloodwork online without a doctor.

item.title: "You will take the entire universe with you"
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 hours ago, fridjonk said:

But there's an additional wrinkle. There is no difference between the end and the beginning. So you end up right where you started.

Everywhere is nowhere and nothing. Nothing is not somewhere else. Form = formlessness, formlessness = form.

So in a sense, you already are in that singularity. That singularity is this! You just aren't recognizing it as such.

item.title: "You will take the entire universe with you"
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Think of it this way. Reality is purely subjective.

Now, what do you imagine will happen upon your physical death? Don't you see that the entire universe will go with you? Since it only ever existed in your mind. Once you are dead, you will not be imagining the universe as you used to. And so it will be gone. Under the materialist paradigm you assume that it will still remain. But for it to remain you have to keep imagining it, which you won't be once you're dead.

It's a bit like shutting off a game console. The whole game world disappears until you turn it on again.

That is basically what happens when you sleep.

You just have to bite the bullet that the universe is purely subjective.

item.title: Shocking part of Leo's new video
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
8 minutes ago, billiesimon said:

I don't understand this part.... does this mean that all those awakened monks and yogis we see are just imagination?

Does this mean that the only entity that has to awaken is myself?

But isn't Consciousness divided into infinite probes who have to awaken on their own? As you said in the "meaning of life" video.

It's tricky.

To realize very deeply that self/other is one, you realize that all those others were imaginary from your POV. And there is nothing but your POV. Since you are God and your POV is actually absolute.

It's a hard pill to swallow.

And yet, I bet you won't reach the levels of consciousness I'm talking about without it.

That's the twisted paradox.

item.title: Hypothyroidism Cured With Diet (TSH Lowered from 2.6 to 1.2)
item.description:
in Health, Fitness, Nutrition
3 minutes ago, DrewNows said:

Looking for a cure is the wrong idea here but reversing âdiseaseâ is possible for just about anyone who believes cellular regeneration is possible. Using herbs is a way to speed up the process, but it also depends on how deep one is willing to dig during detox. Itâs definitely no quick fix.Â I imagine you havenât tried a prolonged detox @Leo GuraÂ ?Â 

That's what I mean by "cure". Anything that would stop/heal it.

Of course I've tried all sorts of prolonged detoxes and probably 50 different herbs, none of which worked for me.

item.title: Hypothyroidism Cured With Diet (TSH Lowered from 2.6 to 1.2)
item.description:
in Health, Fitness, Nutrition

Unfortunately hypothyroidism is a complex condition which can have dozens of factors. There is no one standard cure that works for everyone. There are dozens of different cures which address different root causes. I've tried many of them.
